definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)

sentences.english: The background music for the recitation is a variation of the song "Ode to Red Flag".
sentences.chinese: 《红旗颂》的变奏是诗朗诵的音乐背景。

sentences.english: The group perform variations on soul and gospel music.
sentences.chinese: 这个乐队演奏灵歌和福音音乐的变奏曲。
为钢琴而作的有变奏的行板。

sentences.english: In the melody creation commonly used "adds the flowered variation" the technique.
sentences.chinese: 在旋律的创作上，常用“加花变奏”的手法。
谜语变奏曲，作品36之9，猎手。

sentences.english: Green Variations of Waste Vegetable oils.
sentences.chinese: 回收油的绿色变奏曲工作坊。

sentences.english: Five variations for piano on "Rule Britannia".
sentences.chinese: 五对“第大不列颠”钢琴变奏曲。

sentences.english: It has a rollicking beat and follows bluesy changes, but is played with country instruments.
sentences.chinese: 它具有欢快的旋律与蓝调的变奏，并由乡村乐器伴奏。

sentences.english: This famous musician is working on a series of variations on large scale.
sentences.chinese: 著名的音乐家正在创作一部大型变奏曲。

sentences.english: Of course, there are variations to this theme.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这一主旋律也有变奏。

definition: sonata form (one of the large-scale structures used in Western classical music)
